columns.text: In this problem, we will solve for the total net cash flow needed by the company in order to finance the current payroll using the lockbox system.

The lockbox system redirects the payment of the customers to a single mailing address of the bank. The bank will then collect all of these payments and remit them to the company at the end of the day. This allows easier collection of payments especially if the expected average number of payments per day is high.

In order to solve for the cash flow needed, we will first use the formula for available cash:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Available cash}&=\text{Average amount of payment} \times 4\\[15 pt]
&=\$207,000 \times 4\\[15 pt]
&=\$828,000
\end{aligned}$$

The available cash each day is $\$828,000$

Finally, to solve for the cash flow needed, we can simply multiply the future value by $1$ minus the transfer cost.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Payroll amount}&=\$11,601,936 \times (1-0.002)\\[15 pt]
&=\$11,578,732.13
\end{aligned}$$

The amount needed to fund the payroll for the lockbox system is $\$11,578,732.13$
